It emphasizes that built-in protections in SaaS platforms are not enough to handle the level of complexity modern organizations face and that a unified platform is needed to secure, protect, and manage data wherever it resides.

item.title: Iranian Spear-Phishing Attack Impersonates Google, Outlook, and Yahoo Domains
item.description: The article reports a renewed global spear-phishing campaign by the Iranian threat actor Educated Manticore (APT42), targeting high-value individuals with credential theft and bypassing multi-factor authentication through advanced social engineering tactics. The campaign poses a significant risk to academics, journalists, and geopolitical figures, particularly prominent Israeli figures.

item.title: Chinese Hackers Deploy Pubload Malware Using Tibetan Community Lures and Weaponized Filenames
item.description: This article reports on a targeted cyberattack campaign orchestrated by the China-aligned threat actor Hive0154. The campaign involves phishing attacks using culturally sensitive topics to manipulate trust and curiosity within the Tibetan community, as well as targeting other entities such as the U.S. Navy with lures referencing strategic military engagements.

item.title: Microsoft fixes Outlook bug causing crashes when opening emails
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Outlook; CVE(s): None; Summary: A bug causes classic Outlook to crash when opening emails or starting a new message, affecting users across all Microsoft 365 Office channels who updated Outlook for Microsoft 365 earlier this month. The issue occurs because Outlook cannot open the Forms Library.

item.title: US University Targeted by Androxgh0st Botnet Operators for C2 Logger Hosting
item.description: The Androxgh0st botnet has been found to be a persistent and dynamic cyberthreat that has targeted the University of California, San Diego's "USArhythms" portal to host its command-and-control (C2) logger panels. The botnet exploits over 20 vulnerabilities, including Apache Shiro, Spring Framework, WordPress plugins, IoT devices, and others, to execute remote code, steal sensitive data, and deploy cryptomining payloads. It also utilizes webshells and OGNL payloads to maintain persistent access and facilitate further malware deployment.

item.title: Decrement by one to rule them all: AsIO3.sys driver exploitation
item.description: This article appears to be an in-depth analysis of a privilege escalation exploit in a Windows kernel-mode driver. The author provides detailed information on the vulnerabilities and exploitation methods used, including the "decrement by one" primitive. The article also discusses the importance of proper security design and access controls in kernel-mode components.

item.title: Microsoft confirms Family Safety blocks Google Chrome from launching
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Family Safety; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Microsoft Family Safety parental control service is blocking users from launching Google Chrome and other web browsers on Windows systems due to a bug in its web filtering tool, which prompts children to ask for their parents' approval to use other browsers.

item.title: Cybercriminals Use TeamFiltration Pentesting Framework to Breach Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Outlook, and More
item.description: The UNK_SneakyStrike account takeover campaign uses the TeamFiltration pentesting framework to target Microsoft Entra ID user accounts, exploiting credentials and gaining unauthorized access to critical native applications such as Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, and Outlook.

item.title: CISA Issues Alert on Active Exploitation of D-Link Path Traversal Flaw
item.description: Vulnerable Product: D-Link DIR-859 WiFi Router; CVE(s): CVE-2024-0769; Summary: The vulnerability (CVE-2024-0769) is a path traversal vulnerability in the HTTP POST request handler of the router's hedwig.cgi file, allowing attackers to traverse directories and access sensitive configuration files, leading to unauthorized access and potential full control over affected devices.

item.title: Iranian APT35 Hackers Targeting Israeli Tech Experts with AI-Powered Phishing Attacks
item.description: The article reports on a spear-phishing campaign attributed to the Iranian state-sponsored hacking group Educated Manticore (also known as APT35), targeting journalists, high-profile cybersecurity experts, and computer science professors in Israel. The attackers use social engineering tactics, posing as fictitious assistants or using AI-generated messages to trick victims into deploying malware on their systems.

item.title: CISA: AMI MegaRAC bug enabling server hijacks exploited in attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: AMI MegaRAC Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) software; CVE(s): CVE-2024-54085; Summary: A maximum severity vulnerability allows remote unauthenticated attackers to hijack and potentially brick unpatched servers, enabling attacks such as malware deployment, ransomware, firmware tampering, and server physical damage.

item.title: Researchers Demonstrate Windows Registry Manipulation via C++ Program
item.description: The article discusses a C++ program demonstrating how attackers manipulate the Windows Registry to establish persistence, evade defenses, and alter system behavior. The program uses Windows API functions to modify registry keys, simulating tactics employed by real-world malware while highlighting critical defense implications.

item.title: IBM i Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Escalate Privileges
item.description: Vulnerable Product: IBM; CVE(s): CVE-2025-36004; Summary: The vulnerability allows attackers to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code with administrator rights. It affects multiple versions of IBM i, including 7.5, 7.4, 7.3, and 7.2. An attacker can gain unauthorized access to sensitive system resources, compromise the integrity and availability of the system, and potentially take full control of the affected environment.

item.title: Cyber Criminals Exploit Open-Source Tools to Compromise Financial Institutions Across Africa
item.description: This article discusses a series of cyber attacks targeting financial organizations across Africa, using open-source and publicly available tools to maintain access. The attackers use a mix of tools, including PoshC2, Chisel, and Classroom Spy, to commandeer machines and bypass firewalls, with the goal of selling initial access to other criminal actors on underground forums.

item.title: CISA Issues Alert on ControlID iDSecure Flaws Enabling Bypass Authentication
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ControlID iDSecure On-premises; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49851, CVE-2025-49852, CVE-2025-49853; Summary: The software has multiple critical vulnerabilities that allow attackers to bypass authentication, leak sensitive data, and execute malicious SQL commands. Exploitation can lead to unauthorized access, data breaches, and disruption of critical operations.

item.title: CISA Adds 3 Flaws to KEV Catalog, Impacting AMI MegaRAC, D-Link, Fortinet
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: AMI MegaRAC; CVE(s): CVE-2024-54085; Summary: An authentication bypass vulnerability allows a remote attacker to take control of the Redfish Host Interface of AMI MegaRAC SPx, potentially leading to malicious actions such as deploying malware and tampering with device firmware. The flaw has a CVSS score of 10.0.
Vulnerable Product: D-Link DIR-859; CVE(s): CVE-2024-0769; Summary: A path traversal vulnerability in the D-Link DIR-859 router allows for privilege escalation and unauthorized control, potentially allowing an attacker to dump account names, passwords, groups, and descriptions for all users of the device. The router has reached end-of-life (EoL) as of December 2020.
Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiOS; CVE(s): CVE-2019-6693; Summary: A hard-coded cryptographic key vulnerability in FortiOS allows an attacker with access to the CLI configuration or the CLI backup file to decrypt sensitive data, potentially leading to initial access for threat actors linked to the Akira ransomware scheme.

item.title: MOVEit Transfer Systems Hit by Wave of Attacks Using Over 100 Unique IPs
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Progress Software MOVEit Transfer; CVE(s): CVE-2023-34362, CVE-2023-36934; Summary: The MOVEit Transfer file-sharing platform has been targeted by a surge in scanning and exploitation activity. Over 682 unique IP addresses have been detected targeting MOVEit Transfer systems, with the most intense activity beginning on May 27, 2025. Exploitation attempts have been linked to two previously disclosed vulnerabilities (CVE-2023-34362 and CVE-2023-36934).

item.title: Authorities Arrest Five Operators Behind Infamous BreachForums Cybercrime Hub
item.description: Five key operators behind BreachForums, an online marketplace for stolen data, have been arrested by French authorities. The operation targeted suspects believed to be operating from Russian-speaking territories, but the core administrators were revealed to be four French nationals in their early twenties. The arrests are expected to disrupt the global trade in stolen data and serve as a warning to other cybercriminals who rely on such platforms for anonymity and profit.

item.title: WhatsApp Adds AI-Powered Message Summaries for Faster Chat Previews
item.description: WhatsApp has introduced an AI-powered feature called Message Summaries that summarizes unread messages in chats using Meta AI's Private Processing technology. This feature is designed to preserve user privacy and prevent third-party access to message contents. The development comes as the U.S. House of Representatives added WhatsApp to a list of apps banned from government-issued devices due to security concerns.

item.title: Hacker 'IntelBroker' charged in US for global data theft breaches
item.description: A British national, "IntelBroker" (Kai West), has been charged by the US for stealing and selling sensitive data worldwide, causing an estimated $25 million in damages. The stolen information included health records, internal files from companies, and user data from online platforms.

item.title: ZDI-25-424: Mikrotik RouterOS VXLAN Source IP Improper Access Control Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mikrotik RouterOS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6443; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass access restrictions on affected installations of Mikrotik RouterOS without authentication. The specific flaw exists within the handling of remote IP addresses when processing VXLAN traffic, allowing an attacker to gain access to internal network resources.

item.title: ZDI-25-425: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6640; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and it occurs when parsing U3D files due to the lack of validating the existence of an object prior to performing operations on the object.

item.title: ZDI-25-426: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6641; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the parsing of U3D files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-427: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6642; Summary: The PDF-XChange Editor U3D file parsing allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by reading past the end of an allocated object due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data. User interaction is required, and the vulnerability can be exploited by visiting a malicious page or opening a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-428: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6643; Summary: The PDF-XChange Editor U3D file parsing allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information, requiring user interaction. The vulnerability occurs due to the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in a read past the end of an allocated object. An attacker can leverage this to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: ZDI-25-429: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6644; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists in the parsing of U3D files due to a lack of validating the existence of an object prior to performing operations on it.

item.title: ZDI-25-430: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6645; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor by exploiting a use-after-free flaw in the parsing of U3D files. User interaction is required, and an attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.

item.title: ZDI-25-431: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Use-After-Free Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6646; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor through the parsing of U3D files. User interaction is required, and an attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current process.

item.title: ZDI-25-432: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6647; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. It requires user interaction, such as visiting a malicious page or opening a malicious file, and is caused by the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-433: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6648; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor by reading past the end of an allocated object due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data in U3D file parsing. User interaction is required, and the issue can be exploited by visiting a malicious page or opening a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-434: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6649; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the parsing of U3D files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in a read past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-435: PDF-XChange Editor U3D File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6650; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor by exploiting an out-of-bounds read information disclosure flaw within the parsing of U3D files. User interaction is required, and the issue results from a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in reading past the end of an allocated object.

item.title: ZDI-25-436: PDF-XChange Editor JP2 File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6651; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor by parsing out-of-bounds write JP2 files. User interaction is required, and the issue results from lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-437: PDF-XChange Editor PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6652; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor by parsing PRC files without proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in a read past the end of an allocated object. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability.

item.title: ZDI-25-438: PDF-XChange Editor PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6653; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. User interaction is required, and the specific flaw exists within the parsing of PRC files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to an out-of-bounds read information disclosure.

item.title: ZDI-25-439: PDF-XChange Editor PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6654; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor by parsing out-of-bounds write PRC files. User interaction is required, and the issue results from lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to a write past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-440: PDF-XChange Editor PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6655; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. It requires user interaction, such as visiting a malicious page or opening a malicious file, and is caused by the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to a read past the end of an allocated object.

item.title: ZDI-25-441: PDF-XChange Editor PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6656; Summary: The PDF-XChange Editor PRC file parsing allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information by exploiting an out-of-bounds read information disclosure vulnerability. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The issue exists within the parsing of PRC files and can be exploited in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: ZDI-25-442: PDF-XChange Editor PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6657; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information by reading past the end of an allocated buffer due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data in PRC file parsing. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-443: PDF-XChange Editor GIF File Parsing Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6660; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor by exploiting a heap-based buffer overflow in the GIF file parsing. User interaction is required, and the attack vector involves visiting a malicious page or opening a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-444: PDF-XChange Editor PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6658; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information by parsing out-of-bounds read information disclosure. User interaction is required, and the issue results from lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-445: PDF-XChange Editor PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6659; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the parsing of PRC files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-446: PDF-XChange Editor App Object Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6661; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor by exploiting an App object use-after-free remote code execution flaw. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the issue results from a lack of validating the existence of an object prior to performing operations on it.

item.title: ZDI-25-447: PDF-XChange Editor PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PDF-XChange Editor; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6662; Summary: The PDF-XChange Editor PRC file parsing allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information through an out-of-bounds read information disclosure vulnerability. User interaction is required, and the specific flaw exists within the parsing of PRC files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: Hackers turn ScreenConnect into malware using Authenticode stuffing
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise ScreenConnect; CVE(s): None; Summary: Threat actors are modifying the authenticode signature of the ConnectWise ScreenConnect installer to build signed remote access malware. The modified certificate table contains new malicious configuration information, allowing for stealthy access to infected devices.

item.title: ZDI-25-421: Microsoft Azure App Services Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Azure App Services; CVE(s): ZDI-25-421, ZDI-CAN-24622; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Microsoft Azure without authentication. The issue exists within Azure App Services due to the exposure of sensitive information, which can be leveraged by an attacker to disclose information.
